009
010package imagingbook.common.noise.perlin;
011
012import imagingbook.common.noise.hashing.HashFunction;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This class implements a 1-dimensional Perlin noise [1] generator. See Ch. 8
017 * of [2] for details.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] K. Perlin. Improving noise. In "SIGGRAPH’02: Proceedings of the 29th
021 * Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques", pp.
022 * 681–682, San Antonio, Texas (2002).<br>
023 * [2] W. Burger and M.J. Burge. "Principles of Digital Image Processing -
024 * Advanced Methods" (Vol. 3). Undergraduate Topics in Computer Science.
025 * Springer-Verlag, London (2013).
026 * </p>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/11/24
030 */
031public class PerlinNoiseGenerator1d extends PerlinNoiseGenerator {
032        
033        /**
034         * Constructor.
035         * @param f_min minimum frequency
036         * @param f_max maximum frequency
037         * @param persistence persistence
038         * @param hf hash function
039         */
040        public PerlinNoiseGenerator1d(double f_min, double f_max, double persistence, HashFunction hf) {
041                super(f_min, f_max, persistence, hf);
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * 1D combined (multi-frequency) Perlin noise function. Returns the value of the
046         * combined Perlin noise function for the one-dimensional position x.
047         * 
048         * @param x interpolation position
049         * @return the multi-frequency noise value for position x
050         */
051        public double getNoiseValue(double x) {
052                double sum = 0;
053                for (int i = 0; i < F.length; i++) {
054                        sum = sum + A[i] * noise(F[i] * x);
055                }
056                return sum;
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * 1D elementary (single-frequency) Perlin noise function. 
061         * @param x Interpolation position.
062         * @return The value of the elementary Perlin
063         * noise function for the one-dimensional position x.
064         */
065        private double noise(double x) {
066                int p0 = ffloor(x);
067                double g0 = gradient(p0);
068                double g1 = gradient(p0 + 1);
069                double x01 = x - p0;
070                double w0 = g0 * x01;
071                double w1 = g1 * (x01 - 1);
072                return interpolate(x01, w0, w1);
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * @param p discrete position.
077         * @return A pseudo-random gradient value for the discrete 
078         * position p.
079         */
080        private double gradient(int p) {
081                return 2.0 * hashFun.hash(p) - 1;
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Local interpolation function.
086         * @param x01 The interpolation position in [0,1]
087         * @param w0 Tangent value for x=0.
088         * @param w1 Tangent value for x=1.
089         * @return The interpolated noise value at position x01.
090         */
091        private double interpolate(double x01, double w0, double w1) { // local interpolation function (x01 is in [0,1])
092                double s = this.s(x01); 
093                return (1 - s) * w0 + s * w1;
094        }
095}
